org.gannacademy.cdf.graphics

Class Drawable2D

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gannacademy.cdf.graphics.Drawable
      • org.gannacademy.cdf.graphics.Drawable2D
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Arc, Ellipse, Rectangle, RoundRectangle

    public abstract class Drawable2D
extends Drawable

    Superclass of two-dimensional ("rectangular") drawable components

    What makes a component "rectangular"? It's defined by an origin, width and height — like a Rectangle or an Ellipse.

    Author:
    Seth Battis

      • setFrame

        public void setFrame(double x,
                     double y,
                     double width,
                     double height)

        Adjust the frame of the shape's enclosing bounding box

        Adjusting the frame of the shape resizes the geometry to fit within the new bounds

        Parameters:
        x - coordinate of the origin of the new frame
        y - coordinate of the origin of the new frame
        width - of the new frame
        height - of the new frame

      • getAsPath

        public Path getAsPath()

        Convert a Drawable2D shape into its equivalent Path

        Drawable2D shapes are aligned to the rectangular grid of the cartesian coordinate system: a rectangle always has sides aligned with the X- and Y-axes of the coordinate system. This means that transformations other than translation and scale cannot be performed on Drawable2D shapes, as that would shift them out of alignment with the axes. However, this method converts the shape into a Path, which can be transformed.

        Note that the path returned by this method is a new object, separate from the original Drawable2D shape.

        Returns:
        Path equivalent to the 2D shape
